title: Percy Erceg
text:
Charles Percy Erceg (28 November 1928 – 26 May 2019) was a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. A <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Wing">wing three-quarter</a>, Erceg represented <a href="Northland%20Rugby%20Union">North Auckland</a> and at a provincial level, and was a member of the New Zealand national side, the <a href="All%20Blacks">All Blacks</a>, from 1951 to 1952. He played nine matches for the All Blacks including four internationals.
Affiliating to <a href="Ng%C4%81ti%20Kur%C4%AB">Ngāti Kurī</a>, Erceg represented <a href="M%C4%81ori%20All%20Blacks">New Zealand Māori</a> from 1950 to 1952, and in 1951 he was awarded the <a href="Tom%20French%20Cup">Tom French Cup</a> as the Māori player of the year. He later served as a national Māori selector from 1972 to 1983, was the manager of the New Zealand Māori side that toured Australia and the Pacific Islands in 1979 and coach of the <a href="1982%20New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20union%20tour%20of%20Wales%20and%20Spain">1982 team that toured Wales</a>.
Erceg died in <a href="Kaitaia">Kaitaia</a> on 26 May 2019.
